uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.slave.xdpprocessing.Packets

Class DataWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.juliet.slave.xdpprocessing.Packets.DataWrapper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Message, Packet

    public abstract class DataWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an abstract class that wraps around an array of unsigned bytes and provides functions to read from this byte array and converts the output into signed types of the right size, so that the represented value is preserved.
    Author:
    Lucas Sonnabend

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataWrapper(byte[] pData)
      Create a new DataWrapper object, that encapsulates a byte-array of unsigned bytes.

      Read a single unsigned byte and return it as a char.
      long readLong(int length)
      Read up to the next four unsigned bytes and return them as a long.
      java.lang.String readString(int length)
      Read the next length bytes and return them as a string.

      read a single unsigned byte and return it as an int.

    • Method Detail

      • datapointerAtEnd

        public boolean datapointerAtEnd()
        check whether the datapointer reached the end of the byte array
        Returns:
        true if the datapointer reached the end or overshot, false otherwise

      • readLong

        public long readLong(int length)
        Read up to the next four unsigned bytes and return them as a long. The datapointer advances length steps
        Parameters:
        length - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the bytes as a long

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(int length)
        Read the next length bytes and return them as a string. The datapointer advances length steps.
        Parameters:
        length - number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        ASCII string of the bytes

      • readChar

        public char readChar()
        Read a single unsigned byte and return it as a char. The datapointer advances by one.
        Returns:
        The char

      • readUnsignedByte

        public int readUnsignedByte()
        read a single unsigned byte and return it as an int. The datapointer advances by one.
        Returns:
        the value of the next unsigned byte, as an int

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the encapsulated byte-array.
